column8: How many files at the maximum InnoDB keeps open at the same time.
column47: Number of rows in EVENTS_WAITS_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column99: Maximum number of instrumented condition objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column112: InnoDB Fulltext search maximum token size in characters
column138: Write and flush logs every (n) second.
column151: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_STATEMENTS_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column177: Allow IO bursts at the checkpoints ignoring io_capacity setting.
column190: To desynchronize the node from the cluster
column203: Maximum number of instrumented MUTEX objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column229: Maximum number of instrumented RWLOCK objects. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column242: Path to installation directory. All paths are usually resolved relative to this
column268: The number of leaf index pages to sample when calculating transient statistics (if persistent statistics are not used, default 8)
column281: The value to be returned from LAST_INSERT_ID()
column294: If creating the thread takes longer than this value (in seconds), the Slow_launch_threads counter will be incremented
column307: Maximum number of instrumented user@host accounts. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column333: The character set used for returning query results to the client
column346: Number of InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Partitions (default 8)
column359: The location where the slave should put its temporary files when replicating a LOAD DATA INFILE command
column372: How many additional active worker threads in a group are allowed.
column385: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_WAITS_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column398: FTS internal auxiliary table to be checked
column411: Number of rows per thread in EVENTS_STAGES_HISTORY. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column424: InnoDB Fulltext search number of words to optimize for each optimize table call
column437: If set to 1, the default, warning_count is incremented each time a Note warning is encountered. If set to 0, Note warnings are not recorded. mysqldump has outputs to set this variable to 0 so that no unnecessary increments occur when data is reloaded.
column450: Enable a workaround to handle the cases where inserting a DEFAULT value into an auto-increment column could fail with duplicate key error
column476: If an internal in-memory temporary table exceeds this size, MariaDB will automatically convert it to an on-disk MyISAM or Aria table. Same as tmp_table_size.
column489: Number of thread groups in the pool. This parameter is roughly equivalent to maximum number of concurrently executing threads (threads in a waiting state do not count as executing).
column502: Hostname or IP of the slave to be reported to the master during slave registration. Will appear in the output of SHOW SLAVE HOSTS. Leave unset if you do not want the slave to register itself with the master. Note that it is not sufficient for the master to simply read the IP of the slave off the socket once the slave connects. Due to NAT and other routing issues, that IP may not be valid for connecting to the slave from the master or other hosts
column515: Maximum number of rows in SETUP_OBJECTS.
column528: Memory buffer size for index creation
column541: Number of times the slave SQL thread will retry a transaction in case it failed with a deadlock or elapsed lock wait timeout, before giving up and stopping
column554: Number of undo logs to use (deprecated).
column567: The maximum number of active connections for a single user (0 = no limit)
column580: Whether mysqld was compiled with options for large file support
column593: Number of rows in EVENTS_STAGES_HISTORY_LONG. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column606: How replication events should be executed. Legal values are STRICT (default) and IDEMPOTENT. In IDEMPOTENT mode, replication will not stop for operations that are idempotent. For example, in row based replication attempts to delete rows that doesn't exist will be ignored. In STRICT mode, replication will stop on any unexpected difference between the master and the slave.
column619: This option causes CREATE TABLE to create all TIMESTAMP columns as NULL with DEFAULT NULL attribute, Without this option, TIMESTAMP columns are NOT NULL and have implicit DEFAULT clauses. The old behavior is deprecated.
column632: To automatically control the assignment of autoincrement variables
column645: Log connections and queries to a table or log file. Defaults logging to a file 'hostname'.log or a table mysql.general_logif --log-output=TABLE is used.
column658: Enable scrubbing of compressed data by background threads (same as encryption_threads)
column671: Tells the slave to restrict replication to tables in the comma-separated list.
column684: The maximum length of the result of function GROUP_CONCAT()
column697: The size of the statement cache for updates to non-transactional engines for the binary log. If you often use statements updating a great number of rows, you can increase this to get more performance.
column710: Allocation block size for storing ranges during optimization
column736: The minimum percentage of warm blocks in key cache
column749: Maximum number of instrumented threads. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column775: The character set used for literals that do not have a character set introducer and for number-to-string conversion
column788: Number of threads performing background key rotation and scrubbing
column801: Causes updates to non-transactional engines using statement format to be written directly to binary log. Before using this option make sure that there are no dependencies between transactional and non-transactional tables such as in the statement INSERT INTO t_myisam SELECT * FROM t_innodb; otherwise, slaves may diverge from the master.
column814: Specifies how corrupted tables should be automatically repaired
column840: If the server supports spatial data types, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.
column853: Enable the event scheduler. Possible values are ON, OFF, and DISABLED (keep the event scheduler completely deactivated, it cannot be activated run-time)
column866: INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE has lower priority than selects
column879: What size queue (in rows) should be allocated for handling INSERT DELAYED. If the queue becomes full, any client that does INSERT DELAYED will wait until there is room in the queue again
column892: The account password of the slave to be reported to the master during slave registration
column905: The maximum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index. Note: FULLTEXT indexes must be rebuilt after changing this variable
column931: Creating and dropping stored procedures alters ACLs
column944: If set to 0, MariaDB will not perform large SELECTs. See max_join_size for details. If max_join_size is set to anything but DEFAULT, sql_big_selects is automatically set to 0. If sql_big_selects is again set, max_join_size will be ignored.
column957: If non-zero, number of threads to spawn to apply in parallel events on the slave that were group-committed on the master or were logged with GTID in different replication domains. Note that these threads are in addition to the IO and SQL threads, which are always created by a replication slave
column970: Allocation block size for transactions to be stored in binary log
column983: Don't cache results that are bigger than this
column996: Number of iterations over which the background flushing is averaged.
column1009: Minimum length of sql statement(in statement mode) or record(in row mode)that can be compressed.
column1022: Sync .frm files to disk on creation
column1035: Size of the statement digest. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column1048: Deallocate (punch_hole|trim) unused portions of the page compressed page (on by default)
column1061: Number of best matches to use for query expansion
column1074: Maintain page checksums (can be overridden per table with PAGE_CHECKSUM clause in CREATE TABLE)
column1087: Specifies how MyISAM tables handles CREATE TABLE DELAY_KEY_WRITE. If set to ON, the default, any DELAY KEY WRITEs are honored. The key buffer is then flushed only when the table closes, speeding up writes. MyISAM tables should be automatically checked upon startup in this case, and --external locking should not be used, as it can lead to index corruption. If set to OFF, DELAY KEY WRITEs are ignored, while if set to ALL, all new opened tables are treated as if created with DELAY KEY WRITEs enabled.
column1100: Limit to which innodb_io_capacity can be inflated.
column1113: If set to 1 table names are stored in lowercase on disk and table names will be case-insensitive.  Should be set to 2 if you are using a case insensitive file system
column1126: Number of IOPs the server can do. Tunes the background IO rate
column1139: InnoDB Fulltext search cache size in bytes
column1152: Address to initially connect to cluster
column1165: InnoDB Fulltext search parallel sort degree, will round up to nearest power of 2 number
column1191: Number of hash buckets for open and changed files.  If you have a lot of MyISAM files open you should increase this for faster flush of changes. A good value is probably 1/10 of number of possible open MyISAM files.
column1204: After this many write locks, allow some read locks to run in between
column1217: Maximum number of iterations when executing recursive queries
column1230: Is compression the default for new tables
column1243: Offset added to Auto-increment columns. Used when auto-increment-increment != 1
column1256: Data file autoextend increment in megabytes
column1269: Log queries that are executed without benefit of any index to the slow log if it is open
column1282: Default pointer size to be used for MyISAM tables
column1295: The size of the buffer that is used for joins
column1321: The number of seconds the mysqld server is waiting for a connect packet before responding with 'Bad handshake'
column1334: If set to 1, the query SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE auto_increment_column IS NULL will return an auto-increment that has just been successfully inserted, the same as the LAST_INSERT_ID() function. Some ODBC programs make use of this IS NULL comparison.
column1360: Whether temporary tables should be MyISAM or Aria
column1373: Enable/disable InnoDB defragmentation (default FALSE). When set to FALSE, all existing defragmentation will be paused. And new defragmentation command will fail.Paused defragmentation commands will resume when this variable is set to true again.
column1386: If the server supports secure connections, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. If set to DISABLED, the server was compiled with TLS support, but was not started with TLS support (see the mysqld options). See also have_openssl.
column1412: Max number of times to retry a failed autocommit statement
column1425: Should slave thread do secondary index uniqueness checks
column1438: Enable InnoDB lock monitor output to the error log. Requires innodb_status_output=ON.
column1464: Persistent buffer for query parsing and execution
column1477: If there is more than this number of interrupted connections from a host this host will be blocked from further connections
column1490: Each thread that needs to do a sort allocates a buffer of this size
column1516: Roll back the complete transaction on lock wait timeout, for 4.x compatibility (disabled by default)
column1529: Timeout in seconds to wait for a lock before returning an error.
column1542: Allow only CTEs compliant to SQL standard
column1555: The number of simultaneous clients allowed
column1568: Number of threads to use when repairing Aria tables. The value of 1 disables parallel repair.
column1581: Disable initialization of builtin InnoDB plugin
column1594: Use backup-safe TRUNCATE TABLE and crash-safe RENAME (incompatible with older MariaDB 10.2; ON by default)
column1607: If a read on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up
column1620: File format to use for new tables in .ibd files.
column1633: Abort a currently running load of the buffer pool
column1646: Seconds between sending progress reports to the client for time-consuming statements. Set to 0 to disable progress reporting.
column1659: Enables automatic relay log recovery right after the database startup, which means that the IO Thread starts re-fetching from the master right after the last transaction processed.
column1672: Tells the slave thread to restrict replication to statements where any of the updated tables match the specified database and table name patterns.
column1685: The character set for statements that arrive from the client
column1698: The full path of the relay log file names, excluding the extension.
column1711: Track changes to the session state.
column1724: Make all non-temporary tables read-only, with the exception for replication (slave) threads and users with the SUPER privilege
column1750: Sets the internal state of the RAND() generator for replication purposes
column1763: Maximum length considered for digest text, when stored in performance_schema tables.
column1776: The upper limit of the sleep delay in usec. Value of 0 disables it.
column1789: How many records of space defragmentation should leave on the page. This variable, together with innodb_defragment_fill_factor, is introduced so defragmentation won't pack the page too full and cause page split on the next insert on every page. The variable indicating more defragmentation gain is the one effective.
column1802: Tells the slave thread not to replicate any statement that updates the specified table, even if any other tables might be updated by the same statement.
column1815: Sets the total size of the transactional cache
column1828: Allow reads even when the node is not in the primary component.
column1854: Use strict mode when evaluating create options.
column1880: Last GTID logged to the binary log, per replicationdomain
column1893: Case sensitivity of file names on the file system where the data directory is located
column1906: Variable to set to reject queries
column1919: The maximum BLOB length to send to server from mysql_send_long_data API. Deprecated option; use max_allowed_packet instead.
column1932: Maximum number of instrumented users. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column1945: Whether to use read ahead for random access within an extent.
column1958: Verbosity level for the slow log
column1971: Path to the database root directory
column1984: Timeout in seconds for an idle thread in the thread pool.Worker thread will be shut down after timeout
column2010: The algorithm Innodb uses for deciding which locks to grant next when a lock is released. Possible values are FCFS grant the locks in First-Come-First-Served order; VATS use the Variance-Aware-Transaction-Scheduling algorithm, which uses an Eldest-Transaction-First heuristic.
column2023: Read SQL commands from this file at startup
column2036: The number of connections on extra-port
column2049: Auto-increment columns are incremented by this
column2062: Maximum number of table cache instances
column2075: If statement profiling is available, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. See SHOW PROFILES and SHOW PROFILE.
column2088: The location and name of the file that remembers where the SQL replication thread is in the relay logs.
column2101: Log all queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute to the slow query log file. The argument will be treated as a decimal value with microsecond precision
column2114: The AUTOINC lock modes supported by InnoDB: 0 => Old style AUTOINC locking (for backward compatibility); 1 => New style AUTOINC locking; 2 => No AUTOINC locking (unsafe for SBR)
column2127: Size of tree cache used in bulk insert optimisation. Note that this is a limit per thread!
column2140: Set the language used for the error messages
column2153: Controls selectivity of which conditions the optimizer takes into account to calculate cardinality of a partial join when it searches for the best execution plan Meaning: 1 - use selectivity of index backed range conditions to calculate the cardinality of a partial join if the last joined table is accessed by full table scan or an index scan, 2 - use selectivity of index backed range conditions to calculate the cardinality of a partial join in any case, 3 - additionally always use selectivity of range conditions that are not backed by any index to calculate the cardinality of a partial join, 4 - use histograms to calculate selectivity of range conditions that are not backed by any index to calculate the cardinality of a partial join.5 - additionally use selectivity of certain non-range predicates calculated on record samples
column2166: Wait until History list length is below the specified limit
column2192: Filename to/from which to dump/load the InnoDB buffer pool
column2205: Max number of bytes in sorted records
column2218: Maximum delay of user threads in micro-seconds
column2231: Flush MyISAM tables to disk between SQL commands
column2244: Trigger an immediate dump of the buffer pool into a file named @@innodb_buffer_pool_filename
column2257: The number of bytes to use when sorting BLOB or TEXT values (only the first max_sort_length bytes of each value are used; the rest are ignored)
column2270: scrub spaces that were last scrubbed longer than  innodb_background_scrub_data_interval seconds ago
column2296: Enable InnoDB monitor output to the error log.
column2309: The proxy user account name used when logging in
column2322: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column2335: Maximum space to use for all relay logs
column2348: Enable InnoDB adaptive hash index (enabled by default).  Disable with --skip-innodb-adaptive-hash-index.
column2361: Log some not critical warnings to the general log file.Value can be between 0 and 11. Higher values mean more verbosity
column2387: Binary log will be rotated automatically when the size exceeds this value.
column2400: Speeds up the shutdown process of the InnoDB storage engine. Possible values are 0, 1 (faster) or 2 (fastest - crash-like).
column2413: Don't allow creation of heap tables bigger than this
column2426: The soft upper limit for number of cached stored routines for one connection.
column2439: Use old password encryption method (needed for 4.0 and older clients)
column2452: CRL file in PEM format (check OpenSSL docs, implies --ssl)
column2465: A dedicated thread is created to flush all tables at the given interval
column2478: DEPRECATED. Number of multi-threaded flush threads
column2491: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column2504: Amount of memory a single user session is allowed to allocate. This limits the value of the session variable MEM_USED
column2517: Controls the heuristic(s) applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space. Meaning: 0 - do not apply any heuristic, thus perform exhaustive search; 1 - prune plans based on number of retrieved rows
column2543: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column2556: Enables/disables the logging of entire compressed page images. InnoDB logs the compressed pages to prevent corruption if the zlib compression algorithm changes. When turned OFF, InnoDB will assume that the zlib compression algorithm doesn't change.
column2569: Maximum length considered for digest text.
column2582: Whether to disable OS system file cache for sort I/O
column2595: If set when a transaction is written to the binlog, parallel apply of that transaction will be avoided on a slave where slave_parallel_mode is not aggressive". Can be used to avoid unnecessary rollback and retry for transactions that are likely to cause a conflict if replicated in parallel."
column2608: Use this many iops for background key rotation
column2621: Size of session attribute string buffer per thread. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column2634: If the server supports dynamic loading of plugins, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO.
column2647: Maximum number of rows in SETUP_ACTORS.
column2673: Log slow OPTIMIZE, ANALYZE, ALTER and other administrative statements to the slow log if it is open.
column2686: Print all deadlocks to MariaDB error log (off by default)
column2699: The default storage engine for new tables
column2712: Enable traditional statistic calculation based on number of configured pages (default true)
column2738: Use compatible behavior from previous MariaDB version. See also --old-mode
column2751: Whether the binary log can be compressed
column2764: Percentage of dirty pages allowed in bufferpool.
column2777: A query that has taken more than max_statement_time seconds will be aborted. The argument will be treated as a decimal value with microsecond precision. A value of 0 (default) means no timeout
column2790: Maximum time, in microseconds, to wait for more commits to queue up for binlog group commit. Only takes effect if the value of binlog_commit_wait_count is non-zero.
column2803: Version of the used SSL library
column2816: The size of the buffer used for index blocks for MyISAM tables. Increase this to get better index handling (for all reads and multiple writes) to as much as you can afford
column2829: Don't resolve hostnames. All hostnames are IP's or 'localhost'.
column2842: Use posix_fallocate() to allocate files. DEPRECATED, has no effect.
column2868: SET pseudo_slave_mode= 0,1 are commands that mysqlbinlog adds to beginning and end of binary log dumps. While zero value indeed disables, the actual enabling of the slave applier execution mode is done implicitly when a Format_description_event is sent through the session.
column2881: Each thread that does a sequential scan allocates a buffer of this size for each table it scans. If you do many sequential scans, you may want to increase this value
column2894: Synchronously flush relay log to disk after every #th event. Use 0 to disable synchronous flushing
column2907: Don't write queries to slow log that examine fewer rows than that
column2920: Default encryption key id used for table encryption.
column2933: Path for temporary files. Several paths may be specified, separated by a colon (:), in this case they are used in a round-robin fashion
column2946: Desired maximum UNDO tablespace size in bytes
column2959: Maximum number of instrumented files. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column2985: Controls whether rows should be logged in 'FULL', 'NOBLOB' or 'MINIMAL' formats. 'FULL', means that all columns in the before and after image are logged. 'NOBLOB', means that mysqld avoids logging blob columns whenever possible (eg, blob column was not changed or is not part of primary key). 'MINIMAL', means that a PK equivalent (PK columns or full row if there is no PK in the table) is logged in the before image, and only changed columns are logged in the after image. (Default: FULL).
column2998: Number of seconds to wait for more data from any master/slave connection before aborting the read
column3011: Maximum allowed number of worker threads in the thread pool
column3037: Enable InnoDB locking in LOCK TABLES
column3050: Threadpool priority. High priority connections usually start executing earlier than low priority.If priority set to 'auto', the the actual priority(low or high) is determined based on whether or not connection is inside transaction.
column3076: The type of license the server has
column3102: Percentage of log capacity below which no adaptive flushing happens.
column3115: Value of the COMPILATION_COMMENT option specified by CMake when building MariaDB, for example mariadb.org binary distribution.
column3128: Do not defragment a single index more than this number of time per second.This controls the number of time defragmentation thread can request X_LOCK on an index. Defragmentation thread will check whether 1/defragment_frequency (s) has passed since it worked on this index last time, and put the index back to the queue if not enough time has passed. The actual frequency can only be lower than this given number.
column3141: The number of cached open tables
column3154: If set to 1, single-row INSERTs will produce a string containing warning information if a warning occurs.
column3167: Used with global transaction ID to identify logically independent replication streams. When events can propagate through multiple parallel paths (for example multiple masters), each independent source server must use a distinct domain_id. For simple tree-shaped replication topologies, it can be left at its default, 0.
column3180: When password validation plugins are enabled, reject passwords that cannot be validated (passwords specified as a hash)
column3193: If non-zero, binlog write will wait at most binlog_commit_wait_usec microseconds for at least this many commits to queue up for group commit to the binlog. This can reduce I/O on the binlog and provide increased opportunity for parallel apply on the slave, but too high a value will decrease commit throughput.
column3206: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column3219: Master connection to use for all slave variables and slave commands
column3232: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column3245: DEPRECATED. Ignored in MariaDB 10.5. Reduce redo logging when natively creating indexes or rebuilding tables. Enabling this may slow down backup and cause delay due to page flushing.
column3258: Maximum query execution time in milliseconds,before an executing non-yielding thread is considered stalled.If a worker thread is stalled, additional worker thread may be created to handle remaining clients.
column3284: Maximum number of opened instrumented sockets. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column3297: Specify whether to time mutexes. Deprecated, has no effect.
column3310: Default transaction access mode. If set to OFF, the default, access is read/write. If set to ON, access is read-only. The SET TRANSACTION statement can also change the value of this variable. See SET TRANSACTION and START TRANSACTION.
column3323: The external user account used when logging in
column3336: Interval between tries to do an automatic checkpoints. In seconds; 0 means 'no automatic checkpoints' which makes sense only for testing.
column3362: Number of undo logs to use.
column3375: Current GTID position of the server. Per replication domain, this is either the last GTID replicated by a slave thread, or the GTID logged to the binary log, whichever is most recent.
column3388: Port number to use for connection or 0 to default to, my.cnf, $MYSQL_TCP_PORT, /etc/services, built-in default (3306), whatever comes first
column3401: If larger than 1, when repairing a MyISAM table all indexes will be created in parallel, with one thread per index. The value of 1 disables parallel repair
column3414: Skip the next N events from the master log
column3427: The machine type or architecture MariaDB was built on, for example i686.
column3440: If set to FALSE (the default), then when --log-bin is used, creation of a stored function (or trigger) is allowed only to users having the SUPER privilege and only if this stored function (trigger) may not break binary logging. Note that if ALL connections to this server ALWAYS use row-based binary logging, the security issues do not exist and the binary logging cannot break, so you can safely set this to TRUE
column3466: Number of consecutive log recovery failures after which logs will be automatically deleted to cure the problem; 0 (the default) disables the feature.
column3479: Command(s) that are executed for each new connection (unless the user has SUPER privilege)
column3492: Block size to be used for MyISAM index pages
column3505: Allocation block size for query parsing and execution
column3518: Sets the total size of the statement cache
column3531: The character set used by the server for storing identifiers
column3544: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column3557: Alias for tmp_memory_table_size. If an internal in-memory temporary table exceeds this size, MariaDB will automatically convert it to an on-disk MyISAM or Aria table.
column3570: Maximum delay between polling for a spin lock (4 by default)
column3583: Define threads usage for handling queries
column3596: It is an alias for innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column3609: OFF = Don't cache or retrieve results. ON = Cache all results except SELECT SQL_NO_CACHE ... queries. DEMAND = Cache only SELECT SQL_CACHE ... queries
column3622: How many defragment stats changes there are before the stats are written to persistent storage. Set to 0 meaning disable defragment stats tracking.
column3635: Version of the used malloc library
column3648: Timeout in seconds an InnoDB transaction may wait for a lock before being rolled back. Values above 100000000 disable the timeout.
column3661: The list of global transaction IDs that were last replicated on the server, one for each replication domain.
column3674: Move blocks to the 'new' end of the buffer pool if the first access was at least this many milliseconds ago. The timeout is disabled if 0.
column3700: The memory allocated to store results from old queries
column3713: Port for connecting to slave reported to the master during slave registration. Set it only if the slave is listening on a non-default port or if you have a special tunnel from the master or other clients to the slave. If not sure, leave this option unset
column3726: If set to 0 (1 is the default), no logging to the binary log is done for the client. Only clients with the SUPER privilege can update this variable. Can have unintended consequences if set globally, see SET SQL_LOG_BIN. Starting MariaDB 10.1.7, this variable does not affect the replication of events in a Galera cluster.
column3752: If the compression failure rate of a table is greater than this number more padding is added to the pages to reduce the failures. A value of zero implies no padding
column3765: Number of log files in the log group. InnoDB writes to the files in a circular fashion.
column3778: Whether mysqld was locked in memory with --memlock
column3791: Don't start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements. If set to zero INSERT DELAYED will be not used
column3804: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column3817: What form of binary logging the master will use: either ROW for row-based binary logging, STATEMENT for statement-based binary logging, or MIXED. MIXED is statement-based binary logging except for those statements where only row-based is correct: those which involve user-defined functions (i.e. UDFs) or the UUID() function; for those, row-based binary logging is automatically used.
column3830: Tell InnoDB to stop any writes to disk
column3843: Tells the slave to write annotate rows events received from the master to its own binary log. Ignored if log_slave_updates is not set
column3856: Enable prefix optimization to sometimes avoid cluster index lookups.
column3869: Don't overwrite stale .MYD and .MYI even if no directory is specified
column3882: Limit LOAD DATA, SELECT ... OUTFILE, and LOAD_FILE() to files within specified directory
column3895: List of operators for MATCH ... AGAINST ( ... IN BOOLEAN MODE)
column3908: Tells the slave thread to continue replication when a query event returns an error from the provided list
column3921: How replication events should be executed. Legal values are STRICT and IDEMPOTENT (default). In IDEMPOTENT mode, replication will not stop for DDL operations that are idempotent. This means that CREATE TABLE is treated as CREATE TABLE OR REPLACE and DROP TABLE is treated as DROP TABLE IF EXISTS.
column3934: Dump only the hottest N% of each buffer pool, defaults to 25
column3947: The character set used by the default database
column3960: Enable encryption for tables. Don't forget to enable --innodb-encrypt-log too
column3986: The collation of the database character set
column3999: This variable is for internal server use
column4012: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column4025: Set the time for this client
column4038: The size of the buffer which InnoDB uses to write log to the log files on disk.
column4064: How many host names should be cached to avoid resolving.
column4077: Name of this node. This name can be used in wsrep_sst_donor as a preferred donor. Note that multiple nodes in a cluster can have the same name.
column4090: Desired maximum length of the purge queue (0 = no limit)
column4103: Maximum number of instrumented hosts. Use 0 to disable, -1 for automated sizing.
column4116: Don't use the fast sort index method to created index if the temporary file would get bigger than this
column4129: Modes for how triggers in row-base replication on slave side will be executed. Legal values are NO (default), YES and LOGGING. NO means that trigger for RBR will not be running on slave. YES and LOGGING means that triggers will be running on slave, if there was not triggers running on the master for the statement. column6615: Controls the durability/speed trade-off for commits. Set to 0 (write and flush redo log to disk only once per second), 1 (flush to disk at each commit), 2 (write to log at commit but flush to disk only once per second) or 3 (flush to disk at prepare and at commit, slower and usually redundant). 1 and 3 guarantees that after a crash, committed transactions will not be lost and will be consistent with the binlog and other transactional engines. 2 can get inconsistent and lose transactions if there is a power failure or kernel crash but not if mysqld crashes. 0 has no guarantees in case of crash. 0 and 2 can be faster than 1 or 3.

Possible values are CRC32 (hardware accelerated if the CPU supports it) write crc32, allow any of the other checksums to match when reading; STRICT_CRC32 write crc32, do not allow other algorithms to match when reading; INNODB write a software calculated checksum, allow any other checksums to match when reading; STRICT_INNODB write a software calculated checksum, do not allow other algorithms to match when reading; NONE write a constant magic number, do not do any checksum verification when reading (same as innodb_checksums=OFF); STRICT_NONE write a constant magic number, do not allow values other than that magic number when reading; Files updated when this option is set to crc32 or strict_crc32 will not be readable by MariaDB versions older than 10.0.4

column7817: Whether to enable additional FTS diagnostic printout
column7830: A number between [0, 100] that tells how oftern buffer pool dump status in percentages should be printed. E.g. 10 means that buffer pool dump status is printed when every 10% of number of buffer pool pages are dumped. Default is 0 (only start and end status is printed).
column7843: If symbolic link support is enabled, will be set to YES, otherwise will be set to NO. Required for the INDEX DIRECTORY and DATA DIRECTORY table options (see CREATE TABLE) and Windows symlink support. Will be set to DISABLED if the server is started with the --skip-symbolic-links option.
column7856: When wsrep_gtid_mode is set, this value is used as gtid_domain_id for galera transactions and also copied to the joiner nodes during state transfer. It is ignored, otherwise.
column7882: The size of the transactional cache for updates to transactional engines for the binary log. If you often use transactions containing many statements, you can increase this to get more performance
column7895: The minimum percentage of warm blocks in key cache
column7908: Size of the mutex/lock wait array.
column7921: How deep to scan LRU to keep it clean
column7934: Helps in performance tuning in heavily concurrent environments. Sets the maximum number of threads allowed inside InnoDB. Value 0 will disable the thread throttling.
column7947: Number of undo tablespaces to use.
column7960: Number of background write I/O threads in InnoDB.
column7973: Time of innodb thread sleeping before joining InnoDB queue (usec). Value 0 disable a sleep
column7986: Number of times a thread is allowed to enter InnoDB within the same SQL query after it has once got the ticket
column7999: Recover database state after crash and exit
column8012: Enable or Disable Truncate of UNDO tablespace.
column8025: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column8038: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column8051: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column8064: DEPRECATED. This setting has no effect.
column8077: Limit assumed max number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key
column8090: Precision of the result of '/' operator will be increased on that value
column8103: Replication thread delay (ms) on the slave server if innodb_thread_concurrency is reached (0 by default)
column8129: The minimum size for blocks allocated by the query cache
column8142: Enable scrubbing of uncompressed data by background threads (same as encryption_threads)
column8155: The internal GTID state of the binlog, used to keep track of all GTIDs ever logged to the binlog.
column8168: Strip all comments from a query before storing it in the query cache
column8194: If set to 1 (0 is default), results from SELECT statements are always placed into temporary tables. This can help the server when it takes a long time to send the results to the client by allowing the table locks to be freed early.
column8207: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column8220: Enable InnoDB doublewrite buffer (enabled by default). Disable with --skip-innodb-doublewrite.
column8233: If large page support is enabled, this shows the size of memory pages
column8246: Set to 0 (don't flush neighbors from buffer pool), 1 (flush contiguous neighbors from buffer pool) or 2 (flush neighbors from buffer pool), when flushing a block
column8259: When reading rows in sorted order after a sort, the rows are read through this buffer to avoid a disk seeks
column8272: Enable atomic writes, instead of using the doublewrite buffer, for files on devices that supports atomic writes. This option only works on Linux with either FusionIO cards using the directFS filesystem or with Shannon cards using any file system.
column8285: Whether there is an active transaction
column8298: Deprecated and ignored; only exists to allow easier upgrade from earlier XtraDB versions.
column8337: Maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer. Values larger than the number of relations in a query result in better query plans, but take longer to compile a query. Values smaller than the number of tables in a relation result in faster optimization, but may produce very bad query plans. If set to 0, the system will automatically pick a reasonable value.
column8350: Maximum number of opened instrumented files.
